Lesson Narrative

In this lesson, students continue to develop their understanding of solving systems by elimination. Students are given a system that represents the quantities and constraints in a situation. They interpret, in context, the solutions to the individual equations and to the system. They then use the context to make sense of the sum of the two equations and why it shares a solution with the equations in the given system. Along the way, students begin to formulate a logical explanation as to why adding (or subtracting) the two equations in a system can be helpful for identifying the solution to the system.

Students also practice solving systems by adding and subtracting equations and checking their solutions. They also encounter systems where one variable cannot be easily eliminated (given what they know at this point), motivating the need for another strategy.

Learning Goals (Teacher Facing)

Students will be able to:

  • Explain (orally and in writing) why adding or subtracting two equations that share a solution results in a new equation that also shares the same solution.
  • Practice solving systems of linear equations by adding or subtracting equations to eliminate a variable.
  • Use context to make sense of an equation that is the sum of two equations in a system and to reason about why this equation shares a solution with the system.

Learning Targets (Student Facing)

  • Explain why adding or subtracting two equations that share a solution results in a new equation that also shares the same solution.

Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills (TEKS)

TEKS Explanation of Coverage
A.5(C) solve systems of two linear equations with two variables for mathematical and real-world problems.
 Full coverage: Lesson provides content that covers all parts of this TEKS.

Lesson Activities

Here are the instructional activities for the lesson:

  • 2.4.1: Writing and Evaluating New Equations
  • 2.4.2: Adding Two Equations in a System
    • 2.4.2: Self Check 
    • 2.4.2: Additional Resources
  • 2.4.3: Solving Systems of Linear Equations in Two Variables
    • 2.4.3: Self Check 
    • 2.4.3: Additional Resources
  • 2.4.4: Solving Systems of Equations Using Real-World Examples 
Students will also complete a series of problems in the 2.4.5: Practice.

Required Materials

  • Graphing Technology

Required Preparation

Acquire devices that can run Desmos (recommended) or other graphing technology. It is ideal if each student has their own device. 

Lesson Vocabulary

During this lesson, it is important to:

  • Familiarize students with the vocabulary words they will see throughout the lesson. Encourage students to look for these words and notice their use and meanings.
  • Encourage students to use key vocabulary words in “math talk” and their written and oral explanations.
  • Utilize a word wall. Sample cards are located here: Mathematics Vocabulary Word Wall Cards

Vocabulary words that are emphasized in this lesson include:

Previous Vocabulary:

  • system of equations
  • solutions to a system of equations
  • substitution
  • elimination

New Vocabulary:

  • N/A

Support for Building Character

Throughout this unit, find ways to encourage and support students to work on cultivating their growth mindset.

Here are some tips to try during this lesson:

  • Can I or Can’t I?
  • Cultivating Confidence

You can find other tips located here in the Playbook on Growth Mindset from Character Lab.
